pull.title: test: clean up is node stopped
pull.body:
Fixes #27893

Use f'strings for the message when asserting `expected_ret_code` and `return_code`. Change the `expected_ret_code` from an optional to have a default value of `0`.

cc MarcoFalke

events.message: test: clean up is node stopped

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -378,12 +378,9 @@ def is_node_stopped(self, expected_ret_code=None):
 
         # process has stopped. Assert that it didn't return an error code.
         # unless 'expected_ret_code' is provided.
comments.body: You'll have to remove this line as well, because `expected_ret_code` is non-optional now

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -378,12 +378,9 @@ def is_node_stopped(self, expected_ret_code=None):
 
         # process has stopped. Assert that it didn't return an error code.
         # unless 'expected_ret_code' is provided.

@@ -377,13 +377,9 @@ def is_node_stopped(self, expected_ret_code=None):
             return False
 
         # process has stopped. Assert that it didn't return an error code.
-        # unless 'expected_ret_code' is provided.
-        if expected_ret_code is not None:
+        if expected_ret_code != 0:
comments.body: Again, as mentioned previously, the `expected_ret_code` is always provided and will always have to be checked via the assert

             return False
